snippet: Mohamed Morsi was formally sworn in on Saturday as Egypt’s first democratically elected president, marking a new stage in an ever murkier struggle to define the future of the nation.
abstract: Mohamed Morsi is formally sworn in as the first democratically elected president of Egypt, signaling a new stage in an ever murkier struggle to define the future of the nation after six decades of military-backed autocracy; he has vowed to fulfill the goals of the Egyptian revolution by building the institutions of democracy on a foundation of Islamic principles.
lead_paragraph: Mohamed Morsi was formally sworn in on Saturday as Egypt’s first democratically elected president, marking a new stage in an ever murkier struggle to define the future of the nation.

headline.seo: Morsi Is Sworn In as President of Egypt
headline.main: Power Struggle Begins as Egypt’s President Is Formally Sworn In
